DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Confirmation Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate investigator confirmation of the study participant's lost to follow-up status.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Confirmation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements._An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study._Permission to do something._The body of truths or facts accumulated in the course of time, the cumulated sum of information, its volume and nature, in any civilization, period, or country._Having been established or verified._The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: a researcher in a clinical trial or clinical study.

Concepts.definition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.

Property.preferredName: Withdrawal by Subject Lost To Follow-up Confirmation
Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a study participant has removed itself from the study.:The loss or lack of continuation of follow-up after a study has officially closed.  See Follow-up.:Having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a study participant has removed themself from the study or from one or more segments of the study.
The loss or lack of continuation of subject participation after a study has officially closed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

DataElement.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt versioned for change to long name, def and question text per DEC concept, changed reg status and released per Round 5 finalization task.  Creation of alternate question text to accomodate Round 5 NCI Template CRF preferred question text_11.10.14_ghd
